Deficiency Narrative: One out of two children's medication records reviewed contained two medication logs with inaccurate counts in comparison with the actual number of medication left.
Correction Narrative:
The operation responded: Medication log had one incorrect log due to staff not following trained procedures on medication dispensing.  Staff person was reprimanded and retrained one-on-one and Texas Tranquility Estates had a refresher training with all staff on medication policy & procedures.
TTE employees are taught the following administering medication:
	    How to properly identify and administer each residents medication in relation to the current medication list.
	    How to properly record the time, amount of medication dispensed, the remaining amount of medication and their signature on the medication logs for each resident.  
	   How to ensure that the residents are properly taking their medication by closely monitoring the resident when administering medication, having the resident cough once swallowing medication and completing a visual inspection of the residents mouth to ensure the medication was taken.
	    Monitoring the residents for any adverse side effects after taken medication.
	    Where psychotropic and over-the-counter medication are properly stored and locked away in its designated area.
	    Never leaving residents left alone with any medication and having direct visual of the resident when medication is administered.
	    Having the resident to recite their medication to ensure they are fully aware of what medication they are taking.
	    To notify the administrator immediately for any medication errors and or concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of three child files reviewed had documentation indicating only a three-day notice was provided regarding the child's service plan team meeting.
Correction Narrative:
The operation responded: .  To prevent this from happening in the future, I have implemented the following measures:
1.	Enhanced Scheduling Protocols: All treatment plan meetings will now be scheduled with a minimum of two weeks' notice, unless there are urgent circumstances requiring immediate action.
2.	Automated Reminders: I have set up automated calendar reminders to ensure timely notifications are sent out well in advance.
3.	Staff Training: The team has been briefed on the importance of adhering to notice requirements to avoid any disruption or inconvenience.
4.	Process Review: Regular audits of meeting scheduling practices will be conducted to ensure compliance with notice policies.
I am committed to maintaining clear communication and meeting all procedural expectations moving forward.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of three child files reviewed did not contain the PLSP's signature on the child's service plan.
Correction Narrative:
The operation responded: To prevent this issue from happening again I will do the following:
Review of Procedures: I have thoroughly reviewed the existing processes to identify any gaps that may have led to the omission.
Training and Awareness: All relevant team members have been briefed on the importance of reviewing and signing documents in a timely manner.
Implementation of Checks: I have introduced an additional review step before filing documents to ensure all required signatures are obtained and verified.
Digital Tools: I am considering adopting electronic signature systems to streamline and track document signing processes.
Moving forward, I am committed to maintaining diligent practices to ensure compliance and uphold the standards expected by DFPS.

Correction Narrative: Operation submitted missing background check information. The following email was recieved: I have attached to this email the background check for Ms. Whitley as well as background check history list which shows that Ms. Jones's background check is pending at this time.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough it was observed that the freezer temperature was at 3 degrees  Fahrenheit. This was corrected at inspection when a staff member changed the temperature to 0 degrees Fahrenheit.
A backyard water feature that is not currently being used has standing water and other debris inside. This enables the buildup of rainwater potentially presenting a hazard to children in care.
Correction Narrative: An email was received showing where the water feature had been covered using heavy mesh  material as a safety precaution for children in care. Compliance has been met.
